subject: He Will Reply
verse: When they call on me, I will answer; I will be with them in trouble. I will rescue them and honor them. (Psalm 91:15)
reflection: One of the functions of angels is to watch over believers. (Hebrews 1:14) There are many examples of guardian angels through out Scriptures, (I Kings 19 -- Daniel 6 -- Matthew 18 -Luke 16 -- Acts 12) Angels can also be God's messengers (Matthew 2 -- Acts 27:23, 24). I believe it is very comforting to know that God watches over us in times of great stress and fear. WITH THIS FACT WE SHOULD REALIZE WE ALWAYS HAVE GOD'S ATTENTION.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 2:

_When they call on me, I will answer; I will be with them_

_in trouble. I will rescue them and honor them. _(Ps. 91:15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

One of the functions of angels is to watch over believers.

(Heb. 1:14) There are many examples of guardian angels

through out Scriptures, (I Kings 19 -- Dan. 6 -- Mt. 18 -Lk. 16 -- Acts 12) Angels can also be God's messengers

(Mt. 2 -- Acts 27:23, 24). I believe it is very comforting

to know that God watches over us in times of great stress

and fear.

WITH THIS FACT WE SHOULD REALIZE WE ALWAYS HAVE GOD'S

ATTENTION.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: All His Benefits
verse: Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not His benefits. (Psalm 103:2)
reflection: In our walk of faith, we should come to Jesus Christ humbled by our unworthiness. We come with no sense of entitlement as we receive His grace and should be overwhelmed by the abundance of His love. They reminder us of all His benefits. HEAVENLY FATHER, LET US ALWAYS PAUSE TO CONSIDER ALL WE HAVE IN YOU.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 3:

_Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not His benefits. _

(Ps. 103:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In our walk of faith, we should come to Jesus Christ humbled

by our unworthiness. We come with no sense of entitlement

as we receive His grace and should be overwhelmed by the

abundance of His love. They reminder us of all His benefits.

HEAVENLY FATHER, LET US ALWAYS PAUSE TO CONSIDER ALL WE

HAVE IN YOU.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: An Inspiring Heritage
verse: Since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses. let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us. (Hebrews 12:1)
reflection: The Christian life often requires some hard work. It requires us to give up whatever endangers our relationship with God, to run patiently, and to struggle against sin with the power of the Holy Spirit. To live effectively, we must keep our eyes on Jesus. WE WILL STUMBLE IF WE LOOK AWAY FROM HIM TO STARE AT OURSELVES OR AT THE CIRCUMSTANCES AROUND US. WE SHOULD BE RUNNING FOR CHRIST NOT OURSELVES, AND WE MUST ALWAYS KEEP HIM IN SIGHT.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 4:

_Since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of_

_witnesses. let us run with perseverance the race_

_marked out for us_. (Heb. 12:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Christian life often requires some hard work. It requires

us to give up whatever endangers our relationship with God,

to run patiently, and to struggle against sin with the power of

the Holy Spirit. To live effectively, we must keep our eyes on

Jesus.

WE WILL STUMBLE IF WE LOOK AWAY FROM HIM TO STARE AT OURSELVES OR AT THE CIRCUMSTANCES AROUND US. WE SHOULD BE RUNNING

FOR CHRIST NOT OURSELVES, AND WE MUST ALWAYS KEEP HIM IN SIGHT.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: Has There Been A Change
verse: 19 Wee all. are being transformed into His image with ever-increasing glory, which come from the Lord, who is the Spirit. (2 Corinthians 3:18)
reflection: What an amazing thing it would be if people could observe us and say, (2 Corinthians 3:18) LET US REACH OUT IN FRIENDSHIP AND ENCOURAGE THE LONELY!

subject: Do All in Love
verse: Nothing you do for the Lord is ever useless. (I Corinthians 15:58)
reflection: When we serve the Lord, no job or act of love is too menial to matter. REMEMBER - - when doing any job, the eyes of the Lord are on you no matter how menial they may seem. SORRY FOR A HALF FINISHED DEVOTION YESTERDAY! !

subject: Proceed With Eyes of Faith
verse: Now faith is confidence in what we hope for and assurance about what we do not see. (Hebrews 11:1)
reflection: Just as the sun burns away the fog, our faith in God can burn away the haze of doubt. Remember that when we believe that God will fulfill His promises even though we don't see those promises materialize yet, that is when we demonstrate true faith. SO-LET US WALK IN FAITH, WITH, GOD AS OUR GUIDE HE WILL DELIVER!

burn away the haze of doubt. Remember that when we

believe that God will fulfill His promises even though

we don't see those promises materialize yet, that is when

we demonstrate true faith. SO-LET US WALK IN FAITH, WITH, GOD AS OUR GUIDE HE WILL

DELIVER!

subject: Focusing On The Creator
verse: Look to the Lord and His strength; seek His face always. (I Chronicles 16:11)
reflection: When we turn our eyes toward the beautiful face of God, we can find sustaining strength and comfort even in the midst of unanswered questions. WHERE ARE YOU SEARCHING FOR THE ANSWERS TO YOUR QUESTION.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 8, 2019:

_Look to the Lord and His strength; seek His face always. _

(I Chr. 16:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we turn our eyes toward the beautiful face of God,

we can find sustaining strength and comfort even in the

midst of unanswered questions.

WHERE ARE YOU SEARCHING FOR THE ANSWERS TO YOUR QUESTION.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: The Secret To God's Undeserved Grace
verse: By grace you have been saved. (Ephesians 2:5)
reflection: We don't receive spiritual blessings because we're strong; we get them (the secret is) BECAUSE WE BELIEVE IN JESUS. These blessings come only through God's undeserved grace. The penalty of sin and its power over us were miraculously destroyed by Christ on the cross. THROUGH FAITH IN CHRIST WE STAND ACQUITTED, OR NOT GUILTY BEFORE GOD.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 9, 2019:

_By grace you have been saved. _(Eph. 2:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We don't receive spiritual blessings because we're strong;

we get them (the secret is) BECAUSE WE BELIEVE IN JESUS.

These blessings come only through God's undeserved grace.

The penalty of sin and its power over us were miraculously

destroyed by Christ on the cross.

THROUGH FAITH IN CHRIST WE STAND ACQUITTED, OR NOT GUILTY

BEFORE GOD. (Ro. 3:21, 22)

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The Lord gives strength to His people; the Lord blesses His people with peace. (Psalm 29:11)
reflection: The same power that raised Christ from the dead is available to help us with our daily problems. When you feel weak and limited, don't despair. Remember that God can give you strength. THE SAME POWER THAT CONTROLS CREATION AND RAISES THE DEAD IS AVAILABLE TO YOU.

to help us with our daily problems. When you feel weak and

limited, don't despair. Remember that God can give you

strength.

THE SAME POWER THAT CONTROLS CREATION AND RAISES THE DEAD

IS AVAILABLE TO YOU.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: Hope For Those Who Have No Hope
verse: If anybody does sin, we have an Advocate with the Father - - Jesus Christ, the Righteous One. (I John 2:1)
reflection: Jesus, our Advocate, can turn a prison of lost hope, fear, or regret into the place of His presence. Remember, you can't be tried for a case that is no longer on the docket. United with Christ, you are as safe as He is. Don't be afraid to ask Christ to plead your case; HE HAS ALREADY WON IT
original_content:

can't be tried for a case that is no longer on the docket.

HE HAS ALREADY WON IT - - (RO. 8:33, 34, HEB. 7:24, 25

subject: Where To Find True Peace
verse: I sought the Lord, and He answered me; He delivered me from all my fears. (Psalm 34:3)
reflection: When we remember who God is and how much He loves us, we can relax into His peace. WE CAN APPROPRIATE HIS BLESSINGS WHEN WE SEEK HIM.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 12, 2019:

_I sought the Lord, and He answered me; He_

_delivered me from all my fears. _(Ps. 34:3)

When we remember who God is and how much He

loves us, we can relax into His peace.

WE CAN APPROPRIATE HIS BLESSINGS WHEN WE SEEK HIM.

_PASTOR AL._

subject: A Right Response To God
verse: A broken and contrite heart You, God, will not despise. (Psalm 51:17)
reflection: God wants a broken spirit and a broken and repentant heart. You can never please God by outward actions, no matter how good, if your heart attitude is not right. Are you sorry for your sins? Do you genuinely intend to stop? GOD IS PLEASED BY THIS KIND OF REPENTANCE!
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 13, 2019:

_A broken and contrite heart You, God,_

_will not despise. _(Ps. 51:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God wants a broken spirit and a broken and repentant

heart. You can never please God by outward actions, no

matter how good, if your heart attitude is not right. Are

you sorry for your sins? Do you genuinely intend to stop?

GOD IS PLEASED BY THIS KIND OF REPENTANCE!

subject: Putting God's Word Into Practice
verse: Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless is this: to look after orphans and widows in their distress. (James 1:27)
reflection: To keep ourselves from letting the world corrupt us, we need to commit ourselves to Christ's ethical and moral system, not the world's. We are not to adapt to the world's value system, which is money, power, and pleasure. TRUE FAITH MEANS NOTHING IF WE ARE CONTAMINATED BY SUCH VALUES.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 14, 2019:

_Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless_

_ is this: to look after orphans and widows in their distress. _

(Jm. 1:27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

To keep ourselves from letting the world corrupt us, we need

to commit ourselves to Christ's ethical and moral system, not

the world's. We are not to adapt to the world's value system,

which is money, power, and pleasure.

TRUE FAITH MEANS NOTHING IF WE ARE CONTAMINATED

BY SUCH VALUES.

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: Importance of Readjusting Our Focus
verse: Jesus said: "It is very hard for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of heaven. " He added: "It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle. (Matthew 19:23, 24)
reflection: Because it is impossible for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, it appears impossible for a rich person to get into the Kingdom of heaven. But Jesus explains in verse 26: "But nothing is impossible with God. " So what we should realize is, faith in Christ, not in self or riches is what counts. WHAT ARE YOU FOCUSED ON TODAY?
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 15, 2019:

Jesus said: _"It is very hard for someone who is rich to enter _

_the kingdom of heaven." _He added: _"It is easier for a camel _

_to go through the eye of a needle._

(Mt. 19:23, 24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Because it is impossible for a camel to go through the eye of

a needle, it appears impossible for a rich person to get into the

Kingdom of heaven. But Jesus explains in verse 26: _"But _

_nothing is impossible with God."_ So what we should realize is,

faith in Christ, not in self or riches is what counts.

WHAT ARE YOU FOCUSED ON TODAY?

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: The Importance of Understanding God's love
verse: Now abide faith, hope, love, these three; but the greatest of these is love. (I Corinthians 13:13)
reflection: In morally corrupt Corinth, love had been a mixed-up term with little meaning. Today people are still confused about love. Love is the greatest of all human qualities, and it is an attribute of God Himself (I John 4:8). Love involves unselfish service to others, to give evidence that you care. Faith is the foundation and content of God's message; Hope is the attitude and focus; Love is the action. WHEN FAITH AND HOPE ARE IN LINE, YOU ARE FREE TO LOVE COMPLETELY BECAUSE YOU UNDERSTAND HOW GOD LOVES.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 16, 2019:

_Now abide faith, hope, love, these three; but the _

_greatest of these is love. _(I Cor. 13:13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In morally corrupt Corinth, love had been a mixed-up term with

little meaning. Today people are still confused about love. Love

is the greatest of all human qualities, and it is an attribute of
God Himself

(I Jn. 4:8). Love involves unselfish service to others, to give

evidence that you care. Faith is the foundation and content of

God's message; Hope is the attitude and focus; Love is the action.

WHEN FAITH AND HOPE ARE IN LINE, YOU ARE FREE TO LOVE COMPLETELY

BECAUSE YOU UNDERSTAND HOW GOD LOVES.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: God Graciously Offers Forgiveness
verse: Can a man take fire to his bosom, and his cloths not be burned? (Proverbs 6:27)
reflection: God's laws do not forbid good, clean fun, rather they warn us against destroying ourselves through unwise actions or running ahead of God's timetable. GOD'S LAWS ARE NOT ARBITRARY.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 17, 2019:

_Can a man take fire to his bosom, and his cloths _

_not be burned? _(Pro. 6:27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God's laws do not forbid good, clean fun, rather they

warn us against destroying ourselves through unwise

actions or running ahead of God's timetable.

GOD'S LAWS ARE NOT ARBITRARY.

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: Always Follow God's Request
verse: 19; Pray at all times and on every occasion in the power of the Holy Spirit. Stay alert and be persistent in your prayers for all Christians everywhere. (Ephesians 6:18)
reflection: The question has been asked by many, "How can we pray at all times?" One way is to pray quick habitual prayers in response to every situation you meet throughout the day. Another way, Is to order your life around God's desire and teachings so that your very life becomes a prayer. WE SHOULD PRAY FOR ALL BELIEVERS IN CHRIST; SO PRAY FOR THE CHRISTIANS YOU KNOW AND FOR THE CHURCHES AROUND THE WORLD.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 18, 2019;

_Pray at all times and on every occasion in the power_

_of the Holy Spirit. Stay alert and be persistent in your_

_prayers for all Christians everywhere. _(Eph. 6:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The question has been asked by many, "How can we pray

at all times?" One way is to pray quick habitual prayers in

response to every situation you meet throughout the day.

Another way, Is to order your life around God's desire and

teachings so that your very life becomes a prayer.

WE SHOULD PRAY FOR ALL BELIEVERS IN CHRIST; SO PRAY FOR

THE CHRISTIANS YOU KNOW AND FOR THE CHURCHES AROUND

THE WORLD..

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: Adequacy In Christ
verse: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where ever the Spirit of the Lord is, He gives freedom. (2 Corinthians 3:17)
reflection: God has given us His holy Spirit to enable us to speak with Christ's power. He keeps His eye on us, protecting us as we work for Him. As we realize that God has equipped us, we can overcome our feelings of inadequacy. SO SERVING CHRIST, REQUIRES THAT WE FOCUS ON WHAT HE CAN DO THROUGH US.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 19, 2019:

_Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where ever the Spirit_

_of the Lord is, He gives freedom. _(2 Cor. 3:17)

God has given us His holy Spirit to enable us to speak

us as we work for Him. As we realize that God has

equipped us, we can overcome our feelings of inadequacy.

SO SERVING CHRIST, REQUIRES THAT WE FOCUS ON WHAT HE

CAN DO THROUGH US.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: The Importance of Faithfulness
verse: To the pure You show Yourself pure, but to the wicked You show Yourself hostile. (2 Samuel 22:27)
reflection: "To the wicked You show Yourself hostile. " This means that to those who sin, God is a judge who will punish them for their sins. Yes, God will destroy those who are evil. BUT HE WILL RESCUE THOSE WHO ARE HUMBLE!
original_content:

subject: Is God Still Waiting
verse: While he was a long way off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion. (Luke 15:20)
reflection: God's love is constant, patient, and welcoming. He will search for us and give us opportunities to respond, BUT he will not force us to come to Him. Like the father in the story; GOD WAITS PATIENTLY FOR US TO COME TO OUR SENSES.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 21, 2019:

_While he was a long way off, his father saw him and_

_was filled with _compassion. (Lk. 15:20)

God's love is constant, patient, and welcoming. He will search

for us and give us opportunities to respond, BUT he will not

force us to come to Him. Like the father in the story;

GOD WAITS PATIENTLY FOR US TO COME TO OUR SENSES.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: Using Our Gifts Fof Christ
verse: I am coming soon. Hold on to what you have. (Revelation 3:11)
reflection: Christians have differing gifts, abilities, experiences, and maturity. God doesn't expect us to be and act the same, BUT He does expect us to "HOLD ON" to what we have, and to persevere in using our resources for Him. CLINGING TO GOD'S PROMISES IN HARD TIMES STRENGTHENS OUR FAITH.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 22, 2019:

_I am coming soon. Hold on to what you have._

(Rev. 3:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Christians have differing gifts, abilities, experiences,

and maturity. God doesn't expect us to be and act the

same, BUT He does expect us to "HOLD ON" to what we

have, and to persevere in using our resources for Him.

CLINGING TO GOD'S PROMISES IN HARD TIMES STRENGTHENS

OUR FAITH.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: God is ready to respond
verse: God told Mosses, "I am who I am" (Exodus 3:14)
reflection: Mosses wanted to know God's name so the Hebrew people would know who sent him. God called Himself "I am who I am" a name describing His eternal power and unchanging character. Now in a world where values, morals, and laws change constantly, we can find stability and security in our unchanging God. WHAT GOD PROMISED TO THE GREAT PATRIARCHS HUNDREDS OF YEARS EARLIER HE WOULD FULFILL IN MOSSES.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 23, 2019:

God told Mosses, "_I am who I am"_ (Ex. 3:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Mosses wanted to know God's name so the Hebrew people

would know who sent him. God called Himself "_I am who I am"_

a name describing His eternal power and unchanging character.

Now in a world where values, morals, and laws change constantly,

we can find stability and security in our unchanging God.

WHAT GOD PROMISED TO THE GREAT PATRIARCHS HUNDREDS OF YEARS

EARLIER HE WOULD FULFILL IN MOSSES.

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: The Real Source of Our Life
verse: We love Him because He first loved us. (1 John 4:19)
reflection: God's love is the source of all human love, and it spreads like fire. In loving His children, God kindles a flame in their hearts, in turn, they love others, who are warmed by God's love through them. IF WE SHOW JESUS' BEAUTY WITH OUR LIVES, OTHERS WILL SAY, "NO WONDER YOU LOVE HIM. "
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 24, 2018:

_We love Him because He first loved us. _(1 Jn. 4:19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God's love is the source of all human love, and it spreads

like fire. In loving His children, God kindles a flame in their

hearts, in turn, they love others, who are warmed by God's

love through them.

IF WE SHOW JESUS' BEAUTY WITH OUR LIVES, OTHERS WILL SAY,

"NO WONDER YOU LOVE HIM."

_PASTOR AL_

subject: Being truely inspired
verse: 2019: The earth is the Lord's and everything in it. (Psalm 24:1)
reflection: We need to let the world we live in inspire us to worship the One who owns it, because, ALL CREATION BELONGS TO GOD, SEEN AND UNSEEN.

_The earth is the Lord's and everything in it._

_PASTOR AL_

subject: Unexpected encounters can bring unexpected blessings
verse: The Lord repay your work, and a full reward be given to you by the Lord God of Israel. (Ruth 2:12)
reflection: Our reputation is often formed by the people who watch us at work, in town, at home, in church. A good reputation comes by consistently living out the qualities we believe in, NO MATTER WHAT GROUP OF PEOPLE OR SURROUNDINGS WE ARE IN.

VERSE FOR JAN. 26, 2019:

_PASTOR AL_

subject: Christian Life Involves Hard Work
verse: Think about all Christ endured when sinful people did such terrible things to Him, so that you don't become weary and give up. After all you have not given your life. (Hebrews 12:3, 4)
reflection: When we face hardship and discouragement, it is easy to lose sight of the big picture. But we are not alone; there is help. Many have already made it through life enduring far more difficult circumstances than we have experienced. Suffering is the training ground for Christians. IT DEVELOPS OUR PATIENCE AND MAKES OUR FINAL VICTORY SWEET.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 27, 2019:

_Think about all Christ endured when sinful people did _

_such terrible things to Him, so that you don't become _

_weary and give up._ After all you have not given your life.

(Heb. 12:3, 4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we face hardship and discouragement, it is easy to

lose sight of the big picture. But we are not alone; there is

help. Many have already made it through life enduring far

more difficult circumstances than we have experienced.

Suffering is the training ground for Christians.

IT DEVELOPS OUR PATIENCE AND MAKES OUR FINAL VICTORY SWEET.

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: Why Worry When You Can Pray
verse: Don't worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will bring it's own worries. (Matthew 6:34)
reflection: Planning for tomorrow is time well spent, worry about tomorrow is time wasted. Sometimes it's difficult to tell the difference. Worry comes through human interference with the divine plan. WORRY IS INTEREST PAID ON TROUBLE BEFORE IT HAPPENS.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 28, 2019:

_Don't worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will_

_bring it's own worries. _(Mt. 6:34)

Planning for tomorrow is time well spent, worry

difficult to tell the difference. Worry comes through

human interference with the divine plan.

WORRY IS INTEREST PAID ON TROUBLE BEFORE IT HAPPENS.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: Confidently Trusting God for Protection and Peace
verse: I lay down and slept, I woke up in safety. for the Lord was watching over me. (Psalm 3:5)
reflection: Some mornings we do wake up to a very difficult day. When this happens, we can either give in to despair or follow the faith of David. Faith, gratitude, and expectation will enable us to face the most trying day with strong confidence in God. IF THE BEST THINGS ARE NOT POSSIBLE MAKE THE BEST OF THE THINGS THAT ARE POSSIBLE.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 29, 2019:

When this happens, we can either give in to despair or

follow the faith of David. Faith, gratitude, and expectation

will enable us to face the most trying day with strong

confidence in God.

IF THE BEST THINGS ARE NOT POSSIBLE MAKE THE BEST OF

THE THINGS THAT ARE POSSIBLE.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: What's In A Smile (this is a little early)
verse: A happy heart makes the face cheerful, but heartache crushes the spirit. (Proverbs 15:13)
reflection: Let's look to Psalm 4 for some answers. VS. 1 says: we should ask the Lord for relief. VS. 3 says we can find comfort in knowing we are among those who are favored by God. VS. 4 says we can acknowledge our feelings and be quiet before Him. VS. 5 says we can do right. VS. 7 says we need to trust Him to give us overflowing gladness. VS. 8 says we can rest in the assurance of His peace and safety. Remember A HEART TOUCHED BY GRACE SHOULD BRING JOY TO THE FACE.
original_content:

A HEART TOUCHED BY GRACE SHOULD BRING JOY TO THE FACE.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: Building An Early Defense System
verse: Hear my cry for help, my King and my God, for to You I pray. (Psalm 5:2)
reflection: Charles Spurgeon once wrote, "If you are not seeking the Lord, the devil is seeking you. " We must seek the Lord early and rely on His help. SO, let's not move into any new day without being aware of the urgent need for the Lord. Being prepared is the best way to be ready for Satan's attack. SO LET US START EACH DAY WITH OUR ARMOR IN PLACE AND OUR MARCHING ORDERS IN HAND.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 31, 2019:

_Hear my cry for help, my King and my God, for to You_

_I pray. _(Ps. 5:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Charles Spurgeon once wrote, "If you are not seeking the

Lord, the devil is seeking you." We must seek the Lord

early and rely on His help. SO, let's not move into any new

day without being aware of the urgent need for the Lord.

Being prepared is the best way to be ready for Satan's attack.

SO LET US START EACH DAY WITH OUR ARMOR IN PLACE AND OUR

MARCHING ORDERS IN HAND.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: God Is Listening
verse: I, by Your great love, can come into Your house; in reverence I bow down toward Your holy temple. (Psalm 5:7)
reflection: Prayerfulness is not an event; it is a way of being in relationship with God. Prayer is our way of connecting with God in all of life's circumstances. God is always listening. We can -- and should -- talk to Him any time throughout the day. IN PRAYER, GOD HEARS MORE THAN OUR WORDS--HE LISTENS TO OUR HEART.
original_content:
VERSE FOR FEB. 1, 2019:

_I, by Your great love, can come into Your house;in _

_reverence I bow down toward Your holy temple._

(Ps. 5:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Prayerfulness is not an event; it is a way of being in

relationship with God. Prayer is our way of connecting

with God in all of life's circumstances. God is always

listening. We can -- and should -- talk to Him any time

throughout the day.

IN PRAYER, GOD HEARS MORE THAN OUR WORDS--HE LISTENS

TO OUR HEART.

_PASTOR AL_
